meanings.definition: Feeling or expressing regret or sorrow
meanings.sent1: After breaking the vase, she felt sorriest for upsetting her mom.
meanings.sent2: He looked his sorriest when he realized he had forgotten his best friend's birthday.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's sorriest face always made everyone forgive his mischief.
meanings.sent4: Her voice carried the sorriest tone, reflecting her genuine remorse.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the sorriest emotions, evoking a sense of deep sadness.

meanings.definition: Of the poorest quality or condition
meanings.sent1: That old car was the sorriest vehicle on the lot.
meanings.sent2: The sorriest excuse for a sandwich was served at the school cafeteria.
meanings.sent3: The sorriest attempt at a joke left everyone confused instead of amused.
meanings.sent4: The sorriest building in town was finally renovated after years of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The sorriest performance of the night disappointed the audience greatly.
